example_sentence_english: I want to think calmly.
I am thinking about a problem.

notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses
example_sentence_english: A well-thought idea works.

notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses
example_sentence_english: A thought-out solution is useful.

notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses
example_sentence_english: The plans thought out are effective.

notes: used with auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses
example_sentence_english: The thought-out ideas succeed.
I think of you often.
You think too much.
She thinks that it's right.
We think the same way.
You (plural) think too quickly.
They think it's impossible.

translation_english: I was thinking / I used to think
example_sentence_english: I was thinking about that idea.

example_sentence_italian: Tu pensavi troppo spesso al passato.
example_sentence_english: You used to think too often about the past.

example_sentence_italian: Lui pensava sempre al suo lavoro.
example_sentence_english: He was always thinking about his work.
We were thinking of a plan.
You (plural) thought it was easy.
They thought differently.

notes: uses auxiliary 'avere' to form compound tenses; participle generally invariable
example_sentence_italian: Ho pensato a quello che hai detto.
example_sentence_english: I have thought about what you said.
